title: soup
body:

title: shiruko_(food)
body:
A Japanese sweet porridge of azuki beans boiled and crushed, served in a bowl with grilled pieces of [[mochi]] or "shiratama dango":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%99%BD%E7%8E%89. It's often eaten during the winter and can also be found canned.

h4.External Links

*  Web-japan.org article (ENG): http://web-japan.org/nipponia/nipponia28/en/appetit
* Wikipedia article (ENG): https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shiruko
* Wikipedia article (JPN): http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/汁粉

title: tactical_recon_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of the 5th Anniversary event. It is designed to complement [[Bangalore (apex legends)|]]'s [[tactical marksman bangalore|Tactical Marksman]] skin and [[Fuse (apex legends)|]]'s [[tactical artillery fuse|Tactical Artillery]] skin.

title: ascendant_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 19's Uprising event.

title: slingshot_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 12's Unshackled event.

title: blue_bomber_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]]. In this appearance she wears her father [[Viper (titanfall 2)|]]'s helmet (painted blue) and a [[Northstar (titanfall)|]]-styled breastplate over a [[blue bodysuit]].

title: omatsuri_fury_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 9's Genesis event. This skin is a [[summer festival]]-inspired look, in which Valkyrie wears an [[orange kimono]], with bamboo construction for her [[jetpack]].

title: titan_tested_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]]. In this appearance she wears a set of futuristic military armor in a white and orange color scheme.

title: military_grade_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]]. In this appearance she wears a set of futuristic military armor in a green color scheme inspired by [[Master Chief]] from [[Halo (series)|]].

title: punk_rocket_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Rare skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], available as exclusively as a [[twitch.tv|Twitch Prime]] reward for a limited time. This skin recolors Valkyrie's default appearance into a [[punk]]-style look consisting of a [[green shirt|green]] [[striped shirt]], and [[multicolored pants|multicolored]] [[red pants|red]] and [[yellow pants|yellow]] [[plaid pants]], while her hair is changed to be [[black hair|black]] with [[blonde hair|yellow]] [[colored bangs]] and [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]].

title: spatial_anomaly_valkyrie
body: An [[official alternate costume|Epic skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 10's Monsters Within event. This skin recolors Valkyrie's default appearance into an [[alien]], giving her [[purple skin]] and [[solid eyes|solid]] [[black eyes]] with [[no eyebrows]].

title: deep_dive_valkyrie
body: An [[official alternate costume|Epic skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], available as exclusively as a [[twitch.tv|Twitch Prime]] reward for a limited time. This skin recolors Valkyrie's default appearance to consist of a [[brown bodysuit]], while she has [[grey skin]], [[black eyeshadow]], and [[brown hair]].

title: heartbeat_harmonizer_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 16's battle pass.

title: frozen_blossom_valkyrie
body: A [[official alternate costume|Legendary skin]] for [[Valkyrie (apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], released as part of Season 15's Wintertide event. This skin is a [[yuki onna]]-inspired appearance, where Valkyrie has [[blue skin]] and [[black hair]], with an outfit consisting of a [[blue kimono]], [[white pants]], and [[blue footwear|blue]] [[boots]].

title: fluorescent_tech_valkyrie

In this appearance Valkyrie has [[black hair]] with [[purple hair|purple]] [[colored tips]] worn in a [[ponytail]].

In this appearance Valkyrie has [[black hair]] worn in a [[ponytail]] with [[parted bangs]].

title: undersized_breast_cup
body:
When the breast cup of a [[bra]] or [[leotard]] is noticeably too small for the breasts and doesn't properly cover the chest.

Usually seen with [[bra]]s or [[Playboy bunny]]suits. For bikinis, see [[micro bikini]]. Also, the clothing in question must be more or less properly worn, to emphasize the size difference.

h4. See Also
* [[Oversized Breast Cup]]

title: wheelchair
body:
A chair with wheels to serve as a mobility aid when walking is difficult or impossible due to illness, injury, old age, or disability.
Wheelchairs are moved either manually by its user or an attendant or by [[powered wheelchair|a built-in or attached electric motor]].

title: role_reversal
body:
The exchanging of two characters's usual traits or roles. For example: Character A has Character B's height and vice versa, or Character A and Character B doing each other's supposed usual chores.

Although similar, these two tags should not be confused with "role reversal":

* [[costume switch]]: two characters wearing each other's default clothes and nothing else
* [[personality switch]]: two characters having each other's known personalities and nothing else
* [[reversible couple]]: two characters acting dominant and submissive to each other 

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Artistic License]]

title: scott_pilgrim_vs_the_world_(movie)
body:
The 2010 film adaptation of the [i][[Scott Pilgrim (series)|]][/i] comic book series, directed by Edgar Wright. It is a loose adaptation of all six books.

Preceded by an animated short, [i]Scott Pilgrim Vs the Animation[/i], which was a straight adaptation of Scott's high school flashback. Most of the cast also reprised their roles for the next animated installment in the franchise, [i][[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off]][/i].

title: splatoon_1
body:
First installment of the [[Splatoon (series)|]] series, released in 2015 for the [[Wii U]].

There are two major gameplay modes: [b]multiplayer[/b], where the player joins a team and must play against another team and cover the majority of the map with their team's ink while trying to maintain their own designated base by keeping it covered as well, and [b]Hero Mode[/b], where the player follows the story and must clear various stages while battling enemies and bosses as [[Agent 3 (splatoon)|]] of the newly formed [[Squidbeak Splatoon]].

title: zapfish
body:
Small electrical catfish in [[Splatoon (series)|]]. Called [b]Denchinamazu[/b] in the Japanese version.

They are used as an energy source thanks to the electricity they can generate. A larger variation of these creatures known as the [b]Great Zapfish[/b] is capable of powering a city.

In Hero Mode, the player must rescue them from the [[Octarian (enemy)|]] bases by breaking them out of lightbulb-like batteries.

title: sanitized_(splatoon)
body:
A variation of [[octarian (enemy)|]]s that have been sanitized or "disinfected". They have a different coloration, depending on their "level of sanitization". Their skin is pale green/blue, they have [[black sclera]] with neon-blue pupils, and their hair has a blue color, sometimes with a green gradient.

They lose all level of free will, acting as slaves or robots on the testing grounds, and also seem to have no pulse, which could mean that they are already dead.

A prime example is [[Dedf1sh]] or the octoling enemies found in [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]], from which they originated.

h4. External links

* "Inkipedia: Sanitized Octarian":[https://splatoonwiki.org/wiki/Sanitized_Octarian]

title: octotrooper
body:
Foot soldiers for the [[Octarian (enemy)|]] army in the [i][[Splatoon (series)|]][/i] universe.

They resemble large tentacles with humanoid legs, though more aggressive octotroopers may have two tentacles growing out of their heads. They are commonly shown driving a hovercraft-type device on land. Due to their lack of arms, they tend to pilot these craft with the top of their tentacles.

title: takozonesu
body:
Enemies in [i][[Splatoon (series)|]][/i]. Called [b]Octolings[/b] in the English version, though they are distinct from the species also known as [[Octoling]]s. They have since been nicknamed by fans as [b]Octozons[/b].

They are an all-female group of [[Octarian (enemy)|]] soldiers. Like [[Inkling]]s, they can transform into humanoids and wield handheld ink weapons.

Their animal form resembles a small [[octopus]], with their humanoid form being a girl with red octopus tentacles [[tentacle hair|tied in a bouffant]]. As humans, they tend to wear [[goggles]]. Concept art shows that they have purple rings around their bright green eyes (being most prominent in the bottom) and rectangular pupils akin to an actual octopus. Other than this and one of the pictures in the game's credits they are never seen without their goggles. [[Marina (splatoon)|]]'s reveal confirms they can have different hair colors, like Inklings; whether they can have different eye colors is unknown.

title: octarian
body: A biological order of octopi in [i][[Splatoon (series)|]][/i], rendered in Japanese as オクタリアン. Like the [[Inkling]]s, they are shapeshifters and have a humanoid and animal form. [b]Do not use this tag.[/b] If you are looking for the Octarian enemies, see either [[Octarian (enemy)]] or [[Takozonesu]]. If you're looking for Octolings, see [[Octoling]].

title: newcastle_(apex_legends)
body:
Playable legend in [[Apex Legends]], added to the game in Season 13.

Newcastle is a large [[dark-skinned male|dark-skinned man]] in a suit of futuristic [[armor]] worn over a [[purple bodysuit]]. He wears a [[helmet]] with a [[assault visor|visor]] that obscures the top half of his face, and has a large [[beard]]. He is [[bald]] and has [[brown eyes]] under the helmet.

His real name is [b]Jackson Williams[/b] (alias Lamont Craig), [[Bangalore (Apex legends)|]]'s presumed dead older brother. He took on the Newcastle armor and legend persona to protect Harris Valley from the Forgotten Families after the original Newcastle was killed for failing to repay a hefty debt to them.

h4. Tagged [[official alternate costume|Skins]]
* [[Chaperone Newcastle]]
* [[Cosmic Protector Newcastle]]
* [[Sector 7 Savior Newcastle]]

title: b-36_peacemaker
body:
The [b]B-36 Peacemaker[/b] was a gargantuan strategic [[bomber]] first built in 1946 by Consolidated Vultee (later Convair). It was powered by six and later ten engines (6 "radials":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radial_engine driving pusher propellers and 4 podded "turbojets":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turbojet supplementing power when needed) and could carry a maximum of 86,0000 lbs (39,000 kg) of bombs. The typical crew numbered around thirteen to fifteen, with pilots and flight engineers seated in cramped quarters under a bubble canopy.


h4. See also

* [[List of Airplanes]]
* Wikipedia: "Convair B-36":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convair_B-36
* Youtube: "The B-36 Bomber":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eUO3NAZHp9o&feature=fvwrel

title: b-52_stratofortress
body:
A large long-range [[bomber]] operated by the [[United States Air Force]] since 1955. It is powered by eight Pratt & Whitney TF33 turbofans, slung in pods under the shoulder-mounted swept wing. An iconic aircraft of the Cold War, the B-52 can carry a wide variety of bombs, missiles, and other munitions.

The B-52's most famous characteristics include the aforementioned engine pods, its huge wings and skinny body. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Airplanes]]

title: final_flash
body:
Signature attack of [[Vegeta]] from [[Dragon Ball]] series. It consists of the user firing an [[energy beam]] using both of their hands, often in a rapid succession.

While very similar to [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]] in overall gesture, Final Flash typically do not requires the "charging" phase, and the beam emitted from this technique behave in a similar manner to projectile attack, compared to the continuous "wave" attack of Kamehameha's. Though the user can also performs the "charge" to release a long energy beam instead.

h4. See also
* [[Kamehameha (dragon ball)|]]

title: splatoon_3:_side_order
body:
A single-player story mode that was released as "Wave 2" of [[Splatoon 3]]'s Expansion Pass.

This campaign sees the return of [[Agent 8 (Splatoon)|]] from [[Splatoon 2: Octo Expansion]] as they are unexpectedly transported to a colourless & uninhabited version of [b]Inkopolis Square[/b], the main hub of [[Splatoon 2]]. 

The gameplay involves Agent 8 challenging the [b]Spire of Order[/b], a mysterious building that has replaced Inkopolis Square's Battle Lobby (the Deca Tower), in a roguelite fashion.

title: rosalina_(chef)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Rosalina]] in [[Mario Kart Tour]], dressing her as a [[chef]]. She wears a [[grey shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[medium skirt|medium]] [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-striped]] [[blue skirt]] with a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron]] with [[buttons]] over it, along with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[waist bow]]. Also wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[chef hat]] with a [[star hat ornament]], a [[grey pantyhose]], and a pair of [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]]. Often depicted holding a [[cooking pot]].

Wears a [[long dress|long]] [[black dress]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[floral print]], along with a [[white apron]] [[waist apron]] and a [[white headwear|white]] [[hat]]. title: the_weaker_sex_1_(gibson)
body:
A 1903 illustration by Charles Dana Gibson, depicting a man torn between two women and violently swinging his head in both directions. In 1910, Lake Forest University would publish the Forester, a yearbook which features a plagiarized copy of the illustration entitled "Which Girl?", "With Apologies to C. D. Gibson" written underneath. The Forester's rendition of the illustration went viral on Japanese Twitter in early 2024, lending the meme its name in the West.

h4. External links

* Internet Archive: "The original art":[https://archive.org/details/gibsonbookcollec02gibs/page/n121/mode/1up] and "the Forester rendition":[https://archive.org/details/forester13lake/page/124/mode/1up]
* "Twitter: The viral tweet (by Dilletantegenet)":[https://twitter.com/DilettanteGenet/status/1753000432254013486] ("archived":[https://archive.is/PEWAW])
* Know Your Meme: "The Forester 'Which Girl?'":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/the-forester-which-girl]

title: magical_mirai_miku_(2023)
body:
The 2023 [[Magical Mirai (vocaloid)|]] version of [[Hatsune Miku]]. She is designed by [[Lam (ramdayo)|]].

This year's theme is "Hero" and marks the 16th anniversary of Hatsune Miku, making it a special anniversary as it will match her official in-character age.

She has [[blunt bangs]], [[red nails]], a black [[down jacket]] with red interior, red [[baggy pants]], a black [[sleeveless shirt]] with [[navel cutout]], and [[lace-up boots]]. Her twintails are [[detached hair|indirectly]] attached via [[ring hair ornament|rings]]. She wears [[goggles]], a [[chain necklace]] with the number [[39]], and holds a [[megaphone]].

Her theme song is [[Hero (Vocaloid)|]] by Ayase.

Her fan-nickname is "Hero-chan".

title: teireida_mai
body:
[b]The All-Too-Dangerous Backup Dancers[/b]

A [i][[Touhou]][/i] character, introduced as one of the stage 5 bosses in [i][[Hidden Star in Four Seasons]][/i].

Mai has [[short hair|short]], [[green hair]] which she often wears with [[short hair with long locks|two locks]]. She wears a [[green dress]] with [[frills]] and a [[waist apron]]. Her dress is decorated with [[bow|bows]] and [[ribbon|ribbons]]. She has [[green eyes]]. She wears [[green footwear|green]] [[shoes]] with a pair of [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. Her hat is a [[tate eboshi|kazaori eboshi]].

Along with [[nishida satono|Satono]], she is based after Matarajin's  two servants, Teireida and Nishida respectively. Like her mythological counterpart, she is depicted holding a [[bamboo|bamboo plant]] in her character portrait.

Satono and Mai are Okina's loyal servants. They used to be human children, but Okina's magic made them less human. They dance for Okina's sake and are essentially an extension of Okina's power. Mai is depicted as scatterbrained and quick to take action. Her abilities allow her to draw out one's vitality by dancing behind them.

Notably, she's the only girl in the series to use the masculine "Boku" as her first-person pronoun of choice. Do not confuse her with [[mai (touhou)|Mai]] from [[Mystic Square]].

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Mai Teireida":https://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Mai_Teireida

title: halo_3:_odst
body:
A spinoff title in the [[Halo (series)|]] franchise. Set during the events of [[Halo 2]], the game follows a squad of [[ODST]]s dropped into the city of New Mombasa to fight the Covenant invasion.

ODST only featured the campaign and Firefight (a new PvE horde mode that would later be a mainstay in the franchise), and was bundled with a separate disk that contained the multiplayer portion of [[Halo 3]] with all of the post-release DLC instead of a dedicated PvP multiplayer mode.

title: kizuna_ai_inc.
body:
[b]Kizuna AI Inc.[/b] (KizunaAI株式会社, Kizuna Ai Co., Ltd.) is an autonomous subsidiary of Tokyo-based digital production company Activ8, producers of [[Kizuna AI]] from the start, oriented around her and related talent. 

Kizuna's main YouTube channel, named A.I. Channel, debuted November 29, 2016. Following this, a second channel, named A.I.Games, debuted in March 2017 as to concentrate on gaming-related content, together with a unique design for the channel. Kizuna would also spearhead activ8's [[project upd8]], with folks joining squarely because of her even.

Starting from May 2019, as part of her 'Kizuna AI's Everyday' series, the "Multiple AI Project":[https://krazete.github.io/ailog/static] was introduced, to expand the AIs on the main channel. Of the ones who appeared, two would remain. By December 2019, these two other AIs would receive hairclips and nicknames, as to distinguish them from the main AI, being henceforth known as [[love-chan (kizuna ai)|]] and [[AI-pii (kizuna ai)|]].  In late June 2019, a fourth AI debuted, aimed for Chinese audiences, with a unique design and a new channel, named A.I. Channel China. She too would receive a nickname by December, becoming known as [[Kizuna AI (Chinese)|AI-ge]].

On April 20, 2020, in a press release, activ8 announced that they would spinning off Kizuna Ai into her own subsidiary, where she would be joined by her fellow AIs, active from May 11. Later, on May 8, it was announced that love-chan and AI-pii would be spinning off into their own channel, debuting on the 13th.

h4. Talent

title: shenron_(dragon_ball)
body:
[b]Shenron[/b] (lit. "the Dragon God" also spelt [b]Shenlong[/b]) is a powerful entity from [[Dragon Ball]] series. Normally appears as a green [[eastern dragon]] with red eyes. He can be summoned by gathering the seven [[dragon ball (object)|Dragon Balls]] together, which allows him to grant one wish (or later three wishes) for one time only before disappeared.

Due to his prominent appearance, he is one of the most popular and recognizable character of the franchise.

h4. Variants
* [[Black Smoke Shenron]]
* [[Porunga]]
* [[Super Shenron]]
* [[Ultimate Shenron]]

title: gundam_aerial_rebuild
body:
An upgraded and repaired version of the [[Gundam Aerial]]. First seen on Episode 11 of [[Gundam Suisei no Majo]]'s first season/cour, it then made its proper debut in Episode 12. [[Suletta Mercury]] remains as its pilot.

Aerial's upgrade to the Rebuild is reminiscent of [[Gundam GP-01 Full Vernian Zephyranthes]] from [[Gundam 0083]], such as having additional thrusters, armor, and the upgrade and repairs being done at the same time after its initial form got heavily damaged in a previous combat. It also has a mouthpiece with single vent, a rarely used Gundam face design that is only seen in few Gundams such as [[Bolt Gundam]] from [[g gundam|Mobile Fighter G Gundam]], [[Raigo Gundam]] from Gundam SEED Frame Astrays, and Gundam G-First from Gundam U.C. 0096: Last Sun. 

In Season 2, it is [spoilers]revealed that the Gundam Aerial/Rebuild is either the current body or contains the consciousness of [[Ericht Samaya]][/spoilers].

Its real life [[mecha]]nical designer is [[JNT]], who is also the designer of the base Aerial and [[Gundam Lfrith]].

h4. See also
* [[Gundam Aerial slap (meme)]]

title: me-tan
body:
An [[OS-tan]] character. A [[personification]] of the notoriously bad Windows ME (Millennium Edition) operating system, Me-tan is recognized by her [[green hair]] in braided [[twintails]], [[ahoge]], and a blue maid outfit (with the Windows error icon, a "!" in a triangle, for a [[brooch]]).

Me-tan is most often depicted as a klutzy and dull-witted [[maid]] who invariably turns anything she tries to do into a disaster.  She tries to compensate for her ineptitude by being an especially hard worker, which generally only makes matters worse.  Despite (or perhaps because of) her hapless plight, she has traditionally been one of the most popular OS-tans.

h4. External links

* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Os-tan
* http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Me

title: detached_cape
body:
A character is wearing a [[cape]] that is not attached to them directly. Often the result of some magic or technology, though the exact nature needn't be explained.

It should be visually apparent that the cape is not attached to the wearer, otherwise the cape would be visually indistinguishable from a regular cape.

Detached capes may hover anywhere along the body. They are usually near the neck and shoulders, however some may be near the waist or elsewhere (see: post #4053057)

title: z'gok-e
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]MSM-07E Z'Gok-E[/b]

Its designation standing for "Experimental", this [[mobile_suit|MS]] type is a proposed upgrade to the good performing [[Z'Gok]]. An extra claw on each hand, better legs, improved beam cannons in its hands to allow for rapid fire and the replacement of head mounted missiles for torpedo launchers, as well as a myriad of standardized parts following the United Maintenance Plan, were the changes made to [[Zeon]]'s best amphibious mobile suit.

title: das_kapital
body:
[i]Das Kapital, Kritik der politischen Ökonomie[/i] (Capital: Critique of Political Economy)

A treatise of political economy written by [[Karl Marx]].
It is his unfinished masterpiece and often known as the "Bible of Communism."

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Das_Kapital

title: karl_marx
body:
[b]Karl Marx[/b] was a [[germany|German]] philosopher and co-author of [i][[communism|The Communist Manifesto]][/i], along with [[Friedrich Engels]], as well as author of [i][[Das Kapital]][/i]. 

As part of the 200th anniversary of Marx's birth, an initiative of the [[china|Chinese Communist Party]] released a [i]donghua[/i] on the life of Marx called [i][[The Leader]][/i] in early 2019.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karl_Marx]

title: pirarucu_(goonya_monster)
body:
Pirarucu is one of the four main busters in [[Goonya Monster]]. She's a prideful girl from a wealthy family and the step-sister of Clione. She has [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] and wears a blue [[hairclip]] on the right side of her hair. She also wears a [[grey jacket]] with [[buttons]], [[puffy long sleeves]] and a [[multicolored ribbon|multicolored]] [[black ribbon|black]] and [[red ribbon|red]] [[ribbon]] and a [[black skirt]].

In the Japanese version of the game she is voiced by [[Fairouz Ai]] while in the English dub she is voiced by Marissa DuBois.
other_names: ピラルク(グーニャモンスター)

title: toad_(goonya_monster)
body:
Toad is one of the four main busters in [[Goonya Monster]]. He is a [[scientist]] who developed monster-busting weapons prior to the events of the game. Being the oldest member of the group he acts as a father figure to the three other busters. He has [[short hair|short]] [[green hair]] with a [[short ponytail]], green [[facial hair]] and wears an [[orange shirt]] with [[suspenders]] and [[black pants]] under a [[lab coat]].

He is voiced by [[Sugita Tomokazu]] in the Japanese version of the game.
other_names: トード(グーニャモンスター)

title: anemone_(goonya_monster)
body:
Anemone is a playable DLC "buster" character who made her debut in Episode 3 of [[Goonya Monster]]. She is described as an eccentric [[yandere]] who has a crush on [[Toad (Goonya Monster)|]]. She has [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[purple hair|purple]] and [[pink hair]], and [[pink eyes]] and is often seen wearing a [[black dress]] under a [[lab coat]].

In the Japanese version of the game she is voiced by artist and [[voice actor|voice actress]] [[Kitou Akari]], while in the English version she is voiced by Nicky Boland.
other_names: アネモネ(グーニャモンスター)

In the Japanese version of the game she is voiced by [[Aida Rikako]] while Leonie Schliesing voices her in English.

title: macross:_the_first
body:
A new manga adaptation of the first [[MACROSS]] TV series from the 80s. The first issue was released in [[Japan]] during 2009. Is currently ongoing. 

This manga is an alternate telling of the events in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] (with modern character and [[mecha]] designs) that is being serialized in the [b]Shounen Ace[/b] [[comic]] magazine. 

The artist for the new manga series is [[Mikimoto Haruhiko]], who was the character designer for the first and [[macross_7|second]] [i]Macross[/i] TV series.
other_names: マクロスザ・ファースト

title: elina_(queen's_blade)
body:
[b]Elina[/b] (エリナ) is a [[Queen's Blade]] character. Voiced by [[Mizuhashi Kaori]], designed by [[Hisayuki Hirokazu]]. Elina is [[claudette_(queen's_blade)|Claudette]] and [[Leina (queen's blade)|]]'s younger sister. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She fights with a [[spear]] and [[claws]]. Elina dons a [[headband]] with [[fake animal ears]], [[bikini armor]], [[bridal gauntlets]], [[thighhighs]], and a [[sash]]. Most of her clothes have a [[tiger print]] pattern.

In [[Queen's Blade Rebellion]] Elina dons [[twintails]] with a [[headband]] with [[fake animal ears]], all-[[black armor|black]] [[bikini armor]] with a [[center opening]], a [[single gauntlet]], [[thighhighs]], and [[armored boots]].

In [[Queen's Blade Unlimited]] Elina dons a [[headband]] with [[fake animal ears]], [[bikini armor]], a [[single gauntlet]], [[black thighhighs]], a [[white ribbon|white]] [[neck ribbon]], and [[armored boots]].

h4. Variations

* [[Captain of the royal guard elina]]
* [[ruler_of_fangs_elina|Elina (Ruler of Fangs)]]
* [[shadow_tracker_elina|Elina (Shadow Tracker)]]

title: re:if_kara_hajimeru_isekai_seikatsu
body:
Also known as Rem IF or Sloth IF, this story is about what would have happened if Natsuki Subaru and Rem ran away from the Kingdom of Lugunica, abandoned everything behind in the third arc, and live a family life in Kararagi. For a period of 5 years between 2014 to 2018, the author released five web novel chapters that continued the story.

The Natsuki Rem/Sloth IF was the first web novel IF story to receive a light novel adaptation called Re: Life in a Another World from IF.
other_names: Re:IFから始める異世界生活

title: re:zero_kara_tsugihagu_isekai_seikatsu
body: Published on April fools of 2019, Tappei Nagatsuki wrote a chapter, commonly known as Tsugihagu or Gluttony IF, where Murder became a habit for Natsuki Subaru, and started to read the victim's Book of the dead during the sixth arc.

title: re:zero_kara_oboreru_isekai_seikatsu
body: Published on April fools of 2018, Tappei Nagatsuki wrote a chapter, commonly known as Oboreru or Wrath IF. This time, the point of divergence happens in Arc 2, more specifically, after Rem's death. Instead of committing suicide by jumping off of the cliff, Subaru accepts Beatrice's help and proceeds to be teleported away.

title: re:zero_kara_ayamatsu_isekai_seikatsu
body: Published on April Fools of 2017, Tappei Nagatsuki wrote a chapter, commonly known as Ayamatsu or Pride IF. The point of divergence from the main story is Subaru's fourth return-by-death, where Reinhard saves Subaru from hoodlums and ultimately goes on to save him from Elsa. In this timeline, Reinhard doesn't show up to aid Subaru in the alley, as he never chooses to relegate his dignity and call for help. At the absolute rock bottom, Subaru finds that the only way he can go is up, and bound by his own pride, he resolves to "save" Emilia by any means necessary, bringing himself down a much darker path.

title: re:zero_kara_kasaneru_isekai_seikatsu
body: Published on April fools of 2016, Tappei Nagatsuki wrote a chapter, commonly known as Kasaneru or Greed IF, where Natsuki Subaru accepts Echidna's help and forms a contract with her. The actual chapter starts some time after the fifth arc.

title: gate_-_jieitai_ka_no_chi_nite_kaku_tatakaeri
body:
ゲート 自衛隊彼の地にて、斯く戦えり (ゲート じえいたいかのちにてかくたたかえり) 
"Gate - Thus the JSDF Fought There", or simply "Gate". 

A light novel series by Yanai Takumi, based on his own online novella, illustrated by [[Izuka Daisuke]]. 

In August 20XX, a portal to a parallel world known as the "Gate", suddenly appeared in [[ginza (tokyo)|Ginza, Tokyo]] where monsters and human warriors wearing ancient armor poured out of the portal, killing everyone in their way and trying to claim the area as their own. This would later be known as the "The Ginza Incident". Immediately after the attack, the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]]s launches a counter attack, repelling and pushing the invaders back to the Gate and reclaiming Ginza. 

A manga adaptation is adapted by [[Sao Satoru]]. A TV anime adaptation aired Summer 2015 with a continuation in Winter 2016.

Due to the overall theme, the series have been chosen by the [[Japan Self-defense Force]] as a promotional and a recruiting tool for the JSDF since 2016.

title: paffendorf
body:
Paffendorf is a dance duo based in Cologne, Germany. The duo consists of Ramon Zenker, formerly of Fragma, and Gottfried Engels. Paffendorf is best known for the 2002 hit "Be Cool", although they have had various successful hits across Europe.

In this case, paffendorf is another dance meme with various characters from different series. Their actions consist of swinging their arms in a circle and bouncing up and down. Their eyes have stars in them to show excitement.

This action sequence was done in one of the scenes from the series [[Sumomomo Momomo]], where [[Kuzuryuu Momoko]] is in a chibi form and swinging her arms. The earliest video upload was in 2007 with Momoko, but it seems as though it is an [[Izumi Konata]] upload that has taken credit in spreading it further.

The song used for the meme is a speed up version of 'Under my Skin' by Paffendorf.
Japanese name of the meme is "アッーウッウッイネイネ(0ﾟ・∀・) ([i]Ah! U! U! Ine Ine[/i])."

h4. See also

* [[meme]]
* [[Leekspin (meme)|]]
* [[Caipirinha (meme)|]]
* [[Caramelldansen]]
* Sources: "Momoko":/post/show/79013 and "Kanata":/posts/128996

title: mazda_rx-8
body:
A [[sports car]] produced by [[Mazda]] from 2002 to 2011 as a successor to the [[Mazda RX-7|RX-7]]. The RX-8 featured a rotary engine like it's predecessor, though it was notably less powerful. As of it's discontinuation, Mazda has not produced any rotary sports cars.

The RX-8 featured a unique 4-doored coupe design, with two smaller suicide doors positioned near the back seats. While it never reached the level of acclaim that the RX-7 did, it still had a number of appearances in popular racing games - most notably as [[Mia Townsend]]'s car in [[Need for Speed: Most Wanted (2005)|]].

title: sonon_elfie_(umamusume)
body:
An [[umamusume]] character. An energetic athlete who represents the new umamusume mode "U.A.F." along side with [[Tsurugi Ryoka]].

She is reportedly based on "Osumi Eleven":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0001040154/], a racehorse who achieved Open class on dirt but later turned to Dressage. Osumi Eleven's dam, Rosita, was both long-lived and foaled many foals, of which, Osumi Eleven was the last born. "Sonon Elfie" is based on the name of two of his siblings: Sister [b]Sono[/b] and [b]Elfin[/b]. Osumi Eleven's sire was [[Kurofune (racehorse)|]], from which he got his grey coat (and consequently, why Sonon Elfie's hair is grey).

With that in mind, Sonon Elfie has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in a [[side ponytail]] on the right side and [[braided sidelock|her right sidelock is braided]]. She has [[yellow eyes]] and wears a pink headband with a white "XI" adorning it (her main link to Osumi Eleven) and [[ear covers]] of different colors. The left one is yellow, [b]the right one[/b] is green. She wears [[crossed bandaids]] on her forehead.

title: change_of_heart
body:
"Target 1 monster your opponent controls; take control of it until the End Phase." -Effect Description

A spell card from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] that became famous for its simple yet powerful "mind control" effect, causing it to be banned since 2004 and spawned several watered-down version with negative drawbacks. It was unbanned in the TCG in 2022, 17 years after it was added to limited list.

Its artwork depicts an angel split into a light and a dark side.

The card (along with other similar "brainwash" card such as [[Brain Control (yu-gi-oh!)|]]) also gained similar notoriety within the community as [[Hypno]] from [[Pokemon]], as it appeared in several [[hypnosis]] NSFW fanarts.

h4. See also
* [[Brain Control (yu-gi-oh!)|]]
* [[Mind Control (yu-gi-oh!)|]]

title: lois_lane
body:
[b]Lois Lane[/b] is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[DC Comics]]. Lois is an award-winning journalist for the Metropolis newspaper the [i]Daily Planet[/i] and the primary love interest of the superhero [[Superman]] and his alter ego, [[Clark Kent]].  She is also his wife and the mother of their son, [[Jonathan Kent]], the [[Superboy]] of the DC Rebirth Universe.

Has gained resurgent in popularity in 2023 thanks to her redesigned appearance in [[My Adventures With Superman]] series, which depicted her as an outgoing [[tan]]-skinned [[tomboy]] instead of her traditional prim and proper [[office lady]] design in the past.

h4.External links

title: howto:bluesky
body:
Bluesky is a website that serves as a secondary source to Danbooru.

h4. Artist entries

To create or edit an artist entry, click the '?' next to the artist tag in the tag list. In the artist entry, add:

h6. Other Names

* The artist's display name, located beneath the header.
* The artist's Bluesky handle, without the trailing ".bsky.social".
* Any other account names or nicknames on other sites the artist lists in their profile.

h6. URLs

title: ford_mustang_shelby_gt500kr
body: The highest performance variant of the [[Ford Mustang S197]], released in very small production numbers and featuring Shelby branding. This variant was particularly notable for being featured in the [[Knight rider (2008)|2008 Knight Rider reboot]], where [[K.I.T.T]] is portrayed as one.

title: ford_mustang_s650
body:
The seventh (and current) generation of the [[Ford Mustang]], began production in 2023.

This generation of the Mustang is [[Ford]]'s flagship design for [[racecar]]s, being their vehicle in [[NASCAR]] and having GT3 and GT4 versions that compete in various series around the world including the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]] and [[World Endurance Championship]].

title: ford_mustang_s550
body: The 6th generation of the [[Ford Mustang]], produced from 2014 to 2023.

title: ford_mustang_s197
body: The fifth generation of the [[Ford Mustang]], produced from 2004 to 2014. Notably featured a retro-styled appearance designed as a throwback to the [[ford mustang (1st generation)|first generation]] models, which would serve as the core design that future generations would build off of.

title: ford_mustang_sn95
body: The fourth generation of the [[Ford Mustang]], produced from 1994 to 2004. This generation received a design update in 1999, known as the "New Edge" Mustang.

title: ford_mustang_(foxbody)
body: The third generation of the [[Ford Mustang]], produced from 1979 to 1993. Named the Fox platform that it was built on.

title: ford_mustang_ii

title: shelby_gt500
body:
An upgraded high performance variant of the [[Ford Mustang]], produced from 1967 to 1970 for the [[ford mustang (1st generation)|first generation]] models. The GT500 would return in 2005 as a high performance trim level for the [[ford mustang s197|S197]] models, and would remain an option for succeeding generations until 2022.

A blue GT500 is used by [[Rally Vincent]] in [[Gunsmith Cats]].

title: ford_mustang_(1st_generation)
body:
The original [[Ford Mustang]], produced from 1964 to 1973. It had one of the most successful launches of a [[Ford]] vehicle, and is credited as the namesake for the "pony car" segment of [[muscle car]]s.

During it's 9 year run, the original Mustang saw several minor changes and the introduction of various different body styles, including [[convertible]]s and the iconic "Fastback":[https://www.motortrend.com/uploads/2022/01/001-1968-Ford-Mustang-Fastback-TMI-Restomod-pro-touring-Shelby-Blue-Cobra.jpg] styling.

The base model could be upgraded into the high-performance [[Shelby GT500]].

title: glasgow_willy_wonka_experience
body:
A [[charlie and the chocolate factory|Willy Wonka]]-themed event named [i]Willy’s Chocolate Experience[/i] that was held in Glasgow, Scotland in late February of 2024. It quickly went viral because it severely under-delivered on its promised attractions: photos and videos of the event showed a mostly bare warehouse with sparse, Wonka-themed decorations, and the organisers were caught using [[AI-generated]] promotional materials.

The actor's scripts, which were allegedly AI-generated as well, gave rise to an original character called [[the Unknown (Glasgow Willy Wonka)|]]. There's also a widely-circulated photo of a disappointed actress in the role of an [[Oompa Loompa]], standing in front of what looks like an illicit [[laboratory]]. Both of these characters have since gained [[meme]]tic status as a result of the event's notoriety.

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Glasgow Willy Wonka Experience":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/glasgow-willy-wonka-experience

title: blind_men_and_an_elephant
body:
[quote]The parable of the blind men and an elephant is a story of a group of blind men who have never come across an elephant before and who learn and imagine what the elephant is like by touching it. Each blind man feels a different part of the animal's body, but only one part, such as the side or the tusk. They then describe the animal based on their limited experience and their descriptions of the elephant are different from each other.[/quote]

title: doraemon_darake
body:
ドラえもんだらけ ([i]Doraemon Darake[/i], "Full of Doraemon")

A famous episode from "volume 5":https://www.amazon.com/dp/4091400051/ of [[Doraemon]] manga, which involves [[Doraemon (character)|the titular character]] bringing four instances of his future self to help him doing the homework for [[Nobi Nobita]], only for it to ended up with him being beaten up by his future selves.

This episode is notable for displaying the concept of [[time paradox]], as the beaten-up Doraemon would be then brought back into the past by his past self every two hours while he's trying to rest, gradually increase his frustration and resulting into the "8-hour" Doraemon (the fourth copy of future Doraemon bought from 8 hours into the future) beating up his past counterpart.

h4.See also

* [[multiple persona]]
* [[time paradox]]

title: polyanna_youngest_sister
body:
[b]Polyanna Youngest Sister[/b] is a character in [[Elden Ring]]. She is one of the 5 'rot sisters', including [[Millicent (elden ring)|]], [[Mary Eldest Sister]], [[Maureen Second Sister]] and [[Amy Third Sister]]. Polyanna wears the same robes as the other sisters, and wields the same dagger used by [[Melina (elden ring)|]]. Her position as the youngest makes her the fifth sister, [spoiler]though the presence of a small rot bloom beneath the Haligtree may indicate there was another unnamed sister, which would make her the sixth instead.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]She is also a summonable helper during the fight against [[Commander O'Neil (elden ring)|]].[/spoiler]

title: fabulous
body:
Used for male characters who are flamboyant and campy in their style and actions; applicable to men of any sexual persuasion, and of any physical build. Notably attractive to rampant [[sparkle]]s, [[rainbow]]s, [[bishie sparkle]]s, and/or pastel colors.

The term "fabulous" for describing such flamboyant characters can be traced to a [[meme]] involving the mannerisms of [[Koizumi Itsuki]] of [[suzumiya haruhi no yuuutsu|The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya]] and the theatricality of [[Lelouch Vi Britannia]] (particularly, his Zero persona) in [[Code Geass]]. There, it is written as "[b][i]FABULOUS[/i][/b]".

An example of a work with plenty of fabulous to go along with the [[manly]] is [[Araki Hirohiko]]'s [[jojo_no_kimyou_na_bouken|Jojo's Bizarre Adventure]].

h4. See also

* [[yassification (meme)]]
* [[manly]]

title: yuyaki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character from [[Senran Kagura New Wave]].

[b]Yuuyaki[/b] has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]], to complement her [[dark-skinned female|darker]] [[dark skin|skin tone]]. Her upper body only has what seems to be a [[striped bikini|black and white]] bikini top with a collar on it. She has [[short shorts]] and [[knee boots|knee-high boots]], and large black feathery drapes make up her [[detached sleeves]] and loincloth. Two crossed [[sword]]s rest on her back, with a crow perched on her shoulder.

She is the leader of the Touno Tengu Ninja Squad and a second-year student in high school.

Her fighting style centers on slashes from her two long blades.

She's very much aware of what it is to be a leader, and her strong sense of responsibility leads her to mediate in various troublesome situations.

On the other hand, her personality does a complete 180 into brutality when she's got an unsheathed weapon in her hands.  She's fine while she's meditating, but once she loses her patience, snaps, and draws her blade, she ends up becoming the center of the trouble herself.

Age: 16
Gender: Female
Blood Type: Type-O
Birthday: September, 29th
Favorite Food: Fermented Food

Hair Color: [[white hair|White]]
Eye Color: [[black eyes|Black]]
Height: 164cm (5'5")
Bust: 90cm (35") ([[large breasts|F cup]])
Waist: 57cm (22")
Hips: 90cm (35")

Her name can mean "sunset".

title: ohara_mari
body:
Character in [i][[Love Live! Sunshine!!]][/i] Her mother is Japanese, while her father is Italian-American and manages a hotel chain. Due to her upbringing, she speaks with an accent and often inserts English words into her speech every few lines.

Mari is a member of the Aqours sub-unit [[Guilty Kiss (love live!)|]], alongside [[Tsushima Yoshiko]] and [[Sakurauchi Riko]]. She is also Uranohoshi Girls High School's chairwoman.

She has [[blonde hair]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[green eyes|green]] eyes. She has a [[crown braid]] atop her head, and a [[single hair ring]] on her left.

Voiced by [[Suzuki Aina (voice Actor)|]].

It is a one- or two-seater delta-wing [[airplane]] with [[canards]] and a rectangular-section ventral air intake. 13 underwing hardpoints can carry a total of 7,500 kg (16,500 lb) of stores. title: jimmy_neutron_(series)
body:
Jimmy Neutron is an American computer-animated series created by John A. Davis for [[Nickelodeon]]. It began with the 2001 film Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius, before becoming a television series known as The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron, Boy Genius (sometimes shortened to, Boy Genius or commonly Jimmy Neutron), originally airing for three seasons beginning July 20, 2002, and the final episode airing on November 25, 2006. The series follows an 11-year-old genius from Retroville, the titular character [[Jimmy Neutron]], as he goes on adventures with his best friends [[Carl Wheezer]] and [[Sheen Estevez]].

Throughout the series, various mishaps and conflicts occur on these adventures, as Jimmy's various inventions go awry.

title: prometheus_(honkai_impact)
body:
[[Honkai Impact 3rd]] playable character.

Terminal Aide 0017 "Prometheus" was a Previous Era super AI created by [[mei_(honkai_impact)|Dr. MEI]] to predict and manage Honkai attacks. Its exact fate after the coming of Finality is unknown, although [[Mobius (Honkai Impact)|]] is recorded as having spoken to it shortly before that. The version relevant to the Current Era originates from a bubble universe, albeit one almost identical to the main universe.

Appearance-wise, she greatly resembles [[Bronya Zaychik]], to the point that a certain character mistook it for [[Bronya Zaychik (Haxxor Bunny)|Haxxor Bunny]], but has [[red eyes]] and [[robot joints]] and lacks the [[crossed bangs]]. She is also voiced in Japanese by [[Asumi Kana]], but with a robotic filter.

title: sapporo_ichiban
body:
Brand of instant noodles (primarily [[instant ramen|ramen]]) by Sanyo Foods, debuting in 1966 with soy sauce flavor and launching the company's instant noodle business to the stars, followed closely after with miso and shio ramen flavors, along with 'Arabian yakisoba', sold in [[pack noodles|pack]] form.

title: penenko
body:
A series of [[stuffed animal]] plushies that debuted in [[Dragon Ball Super Super Hero]]. The plush is a penguin-cat chimera, which is reflected in its name, being a portmanteau of penguin and neko. It appears in relation to [[Son Gohan]]'s family, and in particular with [[Piccolo]], with his house utterly filled with the plushies, and his smartphone having a [[smartphone case]] in their image (implying there to be a whole slew of merch in their image, which appear in fanart).

h4. External links

* Dragon Ball Official Site: "[Namek Editorial] There's a Plush Toy in Piccolo's House?! Penenko On Sale Soon!!":[https://en.dragon-ball-official.com/news/01_1012.html]

title: gastrodon
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #423 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Ground Pokémon. Its appearance depends on where it is found.

They have a [[forehead mark]] on their head (it is not a [[third eye]]).

* [[Gastrodon (West)]]: The flower-like crest it had as a Shellos has now turned into horns adorning the side of its head, which point directly upwards in a crescent moon shape.
* [[Gastrodon (East)]]: It retains the horns it had as a Shellos, although now fully colored green which point at a 45 degree angle. Its underside up to the bottom of its mouth is blue, its back and the top of its head is completely green, and it has two yellow "fins" adorned on its back.

It evolves from [[Shellos]].
Japanese Name: [b]Tritodon[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Shellos]]
Next Pokémon: [[Ambipom]]

title: shizuku_murasaki
body:
Character from [i][[Hunter x Hunter]][/i].

The member #8 of the [i]Phantom Troupe[/i]. Shizuku is very level-headed, hardly ever betraying any signs of emotion, she does not mince her words, which causes some of her remarks to upset even her fellow Spiders. She is forgetful to the point of short-term memory loss; sometimes she forgets people's names, or that she had ever met them at all. She can be air-headed, which often causes opponents to underestimate her combat abilities. Her nen type is Conjuration.


h5. Visual Characteristics
Shizuku has [[short_hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]], a [[black sweater|black]] [[turtleneck]] [[sweater]] and [[jeans]], accessorized with a [[cross necklace|necklace]] bearing an [[inverted_cross]], similar to the insignia on the back of [[Chrollo Lucilfer]]'s trench coat. Shizuku has a spider [[tattoo]], symbolizing her position as Troupe member #8, on her lower-left abdomen.

title: stark_jegan
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. 

[b]RGM-89S Stark Jegan[/b]

A variant of the [[Jegan]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] with additional armor, shoulder-mounted missiles for fire support, and overall higher performance. These additional components can be ejected at will by the pilot.

The Stark Jegan has undergone constant iterative redesign. Originally designed by [[Akitaka Mika]] as a [[Char's Counterattack]] Mobile Suit Variation, the Stark Jegan was later redesigned by [[Katoki Hajime]] for use in [[Gundam Unicorn]], a 10-volume set of novels. The design was further altered for the 6-episode Gundam Unicorn OVA series, where it entered canon as a variant of the D-type Jegan, which itself is simply the canonized version of Katoki’s Jegan redesign.

body:
[b]Horosho[/b] (Russian [i]хорошо[/i]; IPA: /xərɐˈʂo/) is a catchword of [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]'s [[Ayase Eli]] and [[Ayase Alisa]], as well as [[Kantai Collection|Kantai Collection's]] [[hibiki (kancolle)|Hibiki]].

body:
The younger sister of [[Kosaka Honoka]]. She has [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and occasionally wears [[red-framed eyewear|red-framed]] [[glasses]] while reading. She's often more mature and responsible than her older sister, though she has a habit of doing embarrassing things when by herself. Yukiho lives in her family's sweets shops with her [[kosaka honoka's mother|mother]], [[kosaka honoka's father|father]] and Honoka. She is good friends with [[Ayase Alisa]].

title: kosaka_honoka
body:
The foremost main character of [[Love Live! School Idol Project]], who decides to form the school idol unit μ's in order to save her school, Otonokizaka High, from closing. Her family runs a Japanese sweets shop, where she lives with her [[kosaka honoka's mother|mother]], [[kosaka honoka's father|father]], and [[kosaka yukiho|younger sister]].

She wears her [[orange hair]] in a [[one side up]] and has [[blue eyes]]. [[Minami Kotori]] and [[Sonoda Umi]] are her childhood friends.

Voiced by [[Nitta Emi]] (JPN), [[Marieve Herington]] (ENG).

title: tojo_nozomi
body:
A character in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]].

Nozomi is the vice president of the student council, and friends with the president, [[Ayase Eli]]. She works as a [[miko]] at the local shrine, and as such she is very spiritual, and frequently uses [[tarot]] cards. The term "washi washi" is associated with her love of [[grabbing another's breast|grabbing breasts]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[swept bangs|swept]] or [[parted bangs]] and [[low twintails]] (usually held with [[hair scrunchie|scrunchie]]s), [[aqua eyes|blue-green eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She usually wears [[black thighhighs]] with her uniform.

Voiced by [[Kusuda Aina]].

title: minami_kotori
body:
A member of μ's in [[Love Live! School Idol Project]]. She is also a member of [[printemps (love live!)|Printemps]], a sub-unit of μ's, alongside [[Kosaka Honoka]] and [[Koizumi Hanayo]]. She attends Otonokizaka High School, where [[minami kotori's mother|her mother]] is the chairwoman. Since the literal meaning of "Kotori" is "little bird," she is sometimes depicted in fan art as a [[minami kotori (bird)|bird]]. 

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair|gray]]-[[brown hair]] arranged in a [[one side up]] with a plume. [[Kosaka Honoka]] and [[Sonoda Umi]] are her childhood friends.

Voiced by [[Uchida Aya]] (JPN), [[Cristina Valenzuela]] (ENG).

title: final_fantasy_i
body:
JRPG developed and published for Famicom/NES by Square, later [[Square Enix]]. First of the [[Final Fantasy]] series, released 18 December 1987 in Japan and some time in May 1990 in North America. Later released on MSX (1989), WonderSwan Color (2000), PlayStation (2002), [[Game Boy Advance]] (2004), PlayStation Portable (2007), Wii (2008), and Apple products (2010).

The game follows the story of [[Warrior of Light (ff1)|four customizable characters]] as they try to restore the light of the elemental orbs they carry and stop the Four Fiends from wreaking havoc across the world, as a result of the actions of [[Garland (ff1)|]], a rogue knight.

A winter 2011 anime series animated by [[Shaft (company)|]], with character designs by [[Aoki Ume]] and written by [[Urobuchi Gen]]. The first installment of the [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]] franchise.

14-year-old [[Kaname Madoka]] was approached by a mysterious creature named [[Kyubey]], who offers her a pact to become a magical girl who fights Witches, creatures born from darkness responsible for murders and suicides in her home city - all the while learning the deeper, darker secrets behind her mission.

title: mahou_sensei_negima!
body:
A 2003-2012 manga series written and illustrated by [[Akamatsu Ken]], with a 2005 anime adaptation by Xebec, a 2006 spinoff anime by [[Shaft (company)|]] (as "Negima!?"), a 2006 manga spinoff of "Negima!?" (as "Negima!? Neo") illustrated by [[Fujima Takuya]], and a 2008-2011 OVA series by Shaft.

Ten-year-old Welsh mage [[Negi Springfield]] is sent to Japan as a teacher as his training to attain the title of "Magister Magi". He ends up at Class 2-A of Mahora Girls' Junior High School, a particularly rambunctious class. Even as he balances teaching and training (with help from some of his students, the first of which is fiery [[Kagurazaka Asuna]]), Negi also attempts to discover about what became of his father [[nagi_springfield|Nagi]], himself a legendary Magister Magi.

It is succeeded continuity-wise by [[UQ Holder!]].

body: Shar, also known as the Nightsinger, is the Goddess of Darkness and Loss, the twin sister of Selûne and the patron deity of Shadowheart. She is associated with the domains of Death and Trickery. Shar cannot be the deity of a custom player Cleric.

title: orin_the_red
body: [[Baldur's Gate 3]] antagonist. One of the Chosen of the Dead Three alongside [[Enver Gortash|Gortash]] and [[Ketheric Thorm|Ketheric]], [spoiler]and the [[the dark urge (baldur's gate)|Dark Urge]]'s half-sister[/spoiler].

title: the_dark_urge_(baldur's_gate)
body:
One of the eight Origin characters in [[Baldur's Gate 3]], exclusive to the player. Though the Dark Urge's race, gender, and appearance is entirely up to the player, their default appearance is a white dragonborn sorcerer. Unlike the custom Origin, playing as Dark Urge provides a predefined story and background, greatly affecting the narrative. Dark Urge's past is shrouded in mystery, save for a never-ending Urge to kill, maim, and murder. It is the player's choice on if they resist or indulge this Urge.

[spoilers]In reality, the Dark Urge is a Bhaalspawn, one who has been "gifted" with the blood of Bhaal, god of murder. The Urge is a result of this blood. Before the events of the game, the Dark Urge was the leader of the Cult of Bhaal and a serial murderer. They were previously in leagues with the game's three major antagonists, Ketheric Thorm, Enver Gortash, Orin the Red, Orin being their subordinate, and the other two being collaborators. However, the three betrayed the Dark Urge, leading to a chain of events that would rob them of their memories and eventually to where the game's story begins.[/spoilers]

title: yari
body:
[quote]
This tag is used for Japanese spears after the mid-"Kamakura period":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamakura_period].
For "槍":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E6%A7%8D#Noun] used as a more broad term, see [[spear]].
Ancient Japanese spear-like [[polearm|polearms]] called 矛, 鉾 (hoko) or 鉾槍 ("hoko yari":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoko_yari]) are simply tagged as [[spear]].
[/quote]

A yari is a long, straight-bladed [[spear]] commonly used by [[samurai]] and other warriors in Japan.

There are two variants of yari; a one-bladed variant for foot soldier, and [[juumonji yari]], a three-bladed variant (similar to [[partisan (weapon)|]]) for [[cavalry]].

h4.See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Fangtian ji]]
* [[Juumonji yari]]

title: t77_submachine_gun
body:
The Type 77 or T77 is a 9×19mm [b][[submachine gun]][/b] of Taiwanese origin, designed in 1985. Visually similar to the ([[mini uzi|Mini]]) [[uzi|Uzi]], it utilizes blowback action, its [[magazine (weapon)|magazine]] insertion integrated into the grip and has a side-[[folding stock]].

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[T77 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links 
* "ModernFirearms.net":https://modernfirearms.net/en/submachine-guns/taiwan-submachine-guns/t-77-2/
* Wikipedia entry: "Type 77 submachine gun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Type_77_submachine_gun]

title: sr-2_veresk
body:
[[Russian text|Russian]]: [b]СР-2 «Вереск»[/b] 

The SR-2 "Veresk" (Heather) [b]is a Russian [[submachine gun]][/b] designed to fire the [[body armor|armour]]-piercing 9×21mm Gyurza [[ammunition|cartridge]]. It was developed in mid-1990s on the request of Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB).

SR-2 differs from most submachine guns by its [b]gas-operated action with rotating bolt[/b], while normally SMGs utilise different blowback principles. Externally the "Veresk" is akin to the [[uzi|Uzi]]; 20 or 30-round magazines are inserted into the pistol grip. There are two [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]]-style control levers on both sides of the receiver: the right one is the safety switch, the left is a fire-mode selector. The charging handle is on the right side and is fixed to the bolt carrier, so it moves during firing. The weapon has a top-[[folding stock|folding metal stock]].

The SR-2M is a modified version that also has a [b]foldable [[vertical foregrip]] under the handguard[/b], with a protrusion to protect the shooter's hand from muzzle blast and accidents (similar to the grip on the MP5K). Its stock can be fully folded even with "red dot" sight installed.

h4. See also
* [[list of weapons]]
* Wikipedia page: "SR-2 Veresk":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SR-2_Veresk]
h1. Not to be confused with
* [[SR-2 Normandy]] - A fantasy [[spacecraft]]
* [[SR-2 Udav]] - Russian [[handgun]]

title: mini_uzi
body:
The [b]smaller, shorter version[/b] of the iconic [[uzi|Uzi]] [b][[submachine gun]][/b], first introduced in 1980. It has a higher automatic rate of fire of 950 RPM due to shorter bolt. The [[weapon]] features a metal side-[[folding stock]] that resembles a vertical foregrip while folded.

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[Micro Uzi]]

title: mac-10/11
body:
The [b]MAC-10[/b] is an American compact [[submachine gun]]/machine pistol first manufactured by Military Armament Corporation in 1964. Chambered in either 9×19mm or .45 ACP.  It has a top-mounted charging handle that also acts as a safety when twisted.

The [b]MAC-11[/b] is the smaller variant, chambered in .380 ACP. Both [[weapon]]s are recognizable by its [[uzi|Uzi]]-like ergonomics but lacks pistol grip and handguard panels, boxier appearance due to less receiver stamping indentations, short strap that acts like a [[vertical foregrip]], and a retractable wire stock. May have a threaded barrel for [[suppressor]]s.

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MAC-10 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h4. External links
* Wikipedia: "MAC-10":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC-10

title: maternity_mark
body:
A [[charm (object)|]] or [[button badge]] given to women in Japan at their first checkup after getting [[pregnant]]. It is so they can prove they are pregnant before it shows in order to use the priority seats on public transit or cut to the front of a line. Also found on stickers to place on cars, much like the "baby on board" sign in the US. It is sometimes called the "baby inside me" mark in English.

It reads: 
おなかに赤ちゃんがいます
Onaka ni Akachan ga imasu
In (my) belly is a baby

body:

The name is said to come from the way dogs stretch after raising up.

Frequently seen when a character is standing up, with their head and torso fully bent forward so they are looking behind them upside-down. There are other possible poses, such as post #3323448, post #2860988, and post #3320641.

This is mutually exclusive from [[view between legs]] since that tag refers to the viewer's perspective. This tag refers to the character's perspective. Both instances may be seen together though, such as post #3155529.

title: mos_eisley
body:
[quote][i]"Mos Eisley Spaceport... You'll never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy..."[/i] - [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]][/quote]

A fictional town from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

[b]Mos Eisley[/b] is a settlement located in planet [[Tatooine]] that serves as [[space]] port for many travelers who arrive and leave the [[planet]]. Because of this many [[spacecraft]] of different sizes and types can be seen constantly leaving and arriving at this area. 

It is also notorious because of the many [[stormtrooper|Imperial troop]] garrisons stationed there to secure the town and the infamy that many smugglers, bandits and fugitives who usually visit it have brought to the place.

[[Han Solo]] and his pal [[Chewbacca]] can be found in Mos Eisley's bars frequently.

title: sangvis_ferri
body:
[tn]Company's short Hanzi name: 铁血工造 / 鐵血工造 / 鉄血工造 ([i]Tiexue Gongzao[/i])
Company's full Hanzi name: 铁血工业製造公司 / 鐵血工業製造公司 ([i]Tiexue Gongye Zhizao Gongsi[/i], "IronBlood Industrial Manufacturing Inc.")
English name: SANGVIS FERRI (probably from Latin [i]"Sanguis":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/sanguis] "Ferri":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/ferri#Latin][/i])
Often simply called "铁血 / 鐵血 / 鉄血" ([i]Tiexue[/i], "Iron Blood").[/tn]

The first, original antagonistic party of [[Girls' Frontline]]. Founded approximately in 2051, Sangvis Ferri was the leading company in doll technology before, during a military intervention, a rogue artificial intelligence slaughtered the staff within its HQ and assumed administrative control of the dolls within. Become gradually acquirable from the Polarized Light event onward, via the "Protocol Assimilation":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E8%9E%8D%E5%90%88%E5%8B%A2%E5%8A%9B] system, for vague story reasons.

Sangvis Ferri troops mostly consist of robotic walkers and drones, but are supplemented by a number of female [[android]]s, typically depicted with [[pale skin]], outlandish weapons and revealing clothes.

title: fudou_yukimitsu
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. The personification of the [[tantou]] "Fudou Yukimitsu".

Once an Oda Nobunaga sword, Fudou Yukimitsu was passed to his loyal attendant, Mori Ranmaru. However, the sword was burnt during the Honnouji Incident and later reforged.

He has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]] and [[purple eyes]]. He wears a [[black jacket]] with [[necktie]], [[shorts]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]]. For his casual outfit, he wears a [[gym uniform]] with a purple [[hoodie]] over it.

Fudou is almost constantly drunk on [[amazake_(drink)|amazake]] and blames himself for not being able to protect Nobunaga at the time of his death. Because of this, he's constantly berating himself and refuses to recognize the [[saniwa_(touken_ranbu)|Saniwa]] as his new master.

After his Kiwame remodel, [spoiler]he gets the chance to meet Nobunaga again. He calls Fudou out for "sacrificing his current self for his past failures", which gives him the motivation to face the future and his current master. When he returns he has sobered up and finally acknowledges the Saniwa as his new master. He's now more cheerful, friendlier and now he's devoted to protect the Saniwa as a way to atone for Nobunaga's death.[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Sakaguchi Daisuke]]. Artist is [[minato_(robin)]].

title: talking_flower_(mario)
body:
Talking Flower/s are characters appear in the Mario series, their first apperance is from Super Mario Bros. Wonder. They are small flowers that talk to the player when approached; the messages they say are small reactions to what is currently ongoing in the level, which may serve as hints. They typically come in orange, but red and blue varieties also exist.  The red variety appears in the Badge Challenges, in The Desert Mystery's Wonder Effect, Color-Switch Dungeon, which appears red when the ON/OFF Switches are set to "ON" and blue when they are set to "OFF", and also appear in The Final-Final Test Badge Marathon. Talking Flowers do not appear in any of the Castle Bowser levels except for The Final Battle! Bowser's Rage Stage, where they have a light-green aura around them, and their speech is distorted and higher-pitched so as to fit the level's theme.

Unlike the other characters, their dialogue is fully voiced, and they have separate voice actors in each of the game’s languages. Players have the option to turn either the speech bubbles or spoken dialogue on and off, and can change the language they can talk in. Their design is reminiscent of the angel's trumpet and devil's trumpet flowers.

According to an interview for Nintendo's Ask the Developer series, the Talking Flowers were a reconfigured version of a concept proposed by producer Takashi Tezuka where the game would provide live commentary on the player's actions. The original idea was scrapped due to it being too much work to implement, with the Talking Flowers being seen as a more practical alternative that better fit the Super Mario franchise.

title: sebring_international_raceway
body:
A historic American [[racetrack]], located in the state of [[Florida (location)|]]. The track occupies a portion of an active [[airport]] for private and recreational flights, and is notorious for it's rough and bumpy surface. As a result, it is used by many American manufacturers to stress test cars during development.

In motorsports, the track is host to the 12 Hours of Sebring, an endurance round of the [[IMSA SportsCar Championship]] that was originally part of the [[World Sportscar Championship]], as well as a weekend of [[GT World Challenge America]]. The track also formerly hosted rounds of [[Formula One]] and the [[World Endurance Championship]], though both series have since replaced their Sebring races with events at [[Circuit of the Americas]].

title: gae_bolg_(fate)
body:
[b]Barbed Spear that Pierces with Death[/b]

[[Cu chulainn (fate/stay night)|]]'s main weapon in the [[Fate (series)|]] series. A long red [[spear]] with an ability to guide itself into piecing the target's heart when commanded.

Also used by his teacher [[Scathach (fate)|]], who wields two of them when using her Noble Phantasm, Gae Bolg Alternative.

Not to be confused with [[Gae Dearg (fate)|]].

Humorously pronounced as "Gay Bulge" in the English dub of the DEEN anime.
